titleStmt.title: Edward D. Townsend, Special Orders, No. 82
CWG12496

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: Union Artillery, Navy and Marines Primary Source Documents ; Misc U.S.C.T. Primary Source Documents

body.p:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, February 19th, 1864.
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 82.
(Extract.)
44. The following named enlisted men are hereby transferred back to their respective companies and regiments, from which they were transferred to the Invalid Corps, not being proper subjects for that Corps, as they do not come within the requirements of Paragraph 3, Section 1, of General Orders, No. 105, of 1863, for Soldiers in the Invalid Corps: --
Private Vanderhaer Clemens, Company "F," 8th Regiment Invalid Corps, to Company "K," 1st Kentucky Volunteers.

The Quartermaster's Department will furnish the necessary transportation.
By order of the Secretary of War:
E. D. TOWNSEND,
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
E D Townsend
Assistant Adjutant General.

1st Infy
War Department
Adjt Genls Office.
Washington
Feby 19. 1864.
Townsend E. D.
A. A. G.
Spe. Ord 82. Private --
Van Clemens Coy F. 8th Regt --
Invalid Corps transferred back to Coy K. 1: Ky Vols
Recd at A. G. O. Feby 24. 1864
